meanings.definition: A large room or hall where people gather to hear a speaker or watch a performance.
meanings.sent1: The school auditorium was filled with students eagerly waiting for the play to start.
meanings.sent2: The auditorium at the concert was packed with excited fans.
meanings.sent3: The magician made the entire auditorium disappear - just kidding!
meanings.sent4: Her laughter echoed through the auditorium like a symphony of joy.
meanings.sent5: The bright lights of the auditorium illuminated the stage beautifully.

meanings.definition: The seating area in a theater or concert hall.
meanings.sent1: We had front-row seats in the auditorium for the ballet performance.
meanings.sent2: The ushers guided us to our seats in the auditorium.
meanings.sent3: The squirrels managed to sneak into the auditorium and enjoy the show.
meanings.sent4: The auditorium of life has many seats, but only a few are truly comfortable.
meanings.sent5: The plush red seats in the auditorium were incredibly comfortable.
